text: Yep I actually ended up doing a similar approach - building the object from the HTML before passing it into the javascript. It can then be JSON.parse'd :slightly_smiling_face: I wish that was something one of the hubl filters did :disappointed:
Well, yes, Hubl is very limited, I wish they can get some functionality from nunjacks in future, since basically Hubl its a liquid or nunjacs with many limits
